description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
This funding opportunity announcement (FOA) aims to support implementation of Health Information Systems (HIS) innovations for patient & disease monitoring along the treatment cascade towards achieving HIV epidemic control in Kenya. The awardee(s) will support the Ministry of Health (MOH), County Health Management Teams (CHMTs), & service delivery partners in strengthening HIS by creating interope Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. objectives

This funding opportunity announcement (FOA) aims to support implementation of Health Information Systems (HIS) innovations for patient & disease monitoring along the treatment cascade towards achieving HIV epidemic control in Kenya. The awardee(s) will support the Ministry of Health (MOH), County Health Management Teams (CHMTs), & service delivery partners in strengthening HIS by creating interoperable systems which are ultimately expected to improve on the health outcomes in the achievement of the 90-90-90 targets. This FOA is aligned with the KASF, Kenya eHealth Strategy and PEPFAR 3.0 goals of controlling the HIV epidemic & achieving an AIDS-free generation. While the implementation will be national in scope, there will be particular emphasis on implementation efforts in high burden areas as prioritized by the HIV prevention, care, & treatment programs to achieve the greatest impact on the epidemic. This FOA is in the spirit of improving the overall efficiency of service and delivery thru interoperable HISs that support HIV/AIDS treatment & provide information for clinical decision support & public health. To transition activities to government partners, there will be an emphasis in using “train the trainer” (TOT) models & mentoring programs at health care sites on end to end aspects of system usage & collaboration with the service delivery partners to assume responsibilities, especially related to data quality & use. There will also be ongoing communication with the MOH regarding infrastructure needs that should be absorbed by the Health Ministry’s budget to promote ongoing system maintenance & use. Monitoring & evaluation will be an integral component of all HIS development & implementation activities & will follow the PEPFAR requirements for Evaluation and Perf

mailing-address.narrative: 2100 Pennsylvania Avenue, Suite 200, Washington, DC 20522, USA

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
